data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What temperature were the X-ray crystallography measurements taken for compounds 1 and 2?
What is the space group of compounds 1 and 2?
What is the yield of compound 1 when synthesized?
What is the role of Ti(salan)-based MOFs in the text?
data.answer: They are used as heterogeneous catalysts for the asymmetric oxidation of thioethers to sulfoxides.

data.question: Is the framework of compound 1 stable up to 315 1C according to TGA analysis?

Does the oxidation reaction of thioanisole, methyl p-tolyl sulfide, and phenyl benzyl sulfide with 4.5 mol% TiL(OBu)2 as the catalyst show higher conversions in the homogeneous system compared to the heterogeneous system?
What is the maximum inner width of the cage in compound 1?
What is the enantioselectivity (ee) of the sulfoxidation product when using (R)-1 as the catalyst for methyl phenyl sulfide?
Does compound 2 show lower enantioselectivities and chemoselectivities than compound 1 for the oxidation of sulfides?
What is the crystal system of compounds 1 and 2?
Are the solid-state CD spectra of 1 and 2 made from R and S enantiomers of the H5L ligand mirror images of each other?
What is the role of aqueous H2O2 in the synthesis described?
data.answer: It is used as an oxidant for the asymmetric oxidation of thioethers to sulfoxides.

data.question: Is the catalytic performance of the monomer TiL(OBu)2 studied for the oxidation of thioanisole, methyl p-tolyl sulfide, and phenyl benzyl sulfide?
What is the conversion rate of benzyl 2-naphthyl sulfide when catalyzed by (R)-1?
Does the oxidation of thioanisole and methyl p-tolyl sulfide give sulfoxides with higher enantioselectivity when using (R)-1 compared to (S)-1?
What is the function of the chiral TiL units in compound 1?
data.answer: They are utilized for the oxidation of thioethers to sulfoxides, indicating their role in catalysis.

data.question: Can the bulky substrate benzyl 2-naphthyl sulfide access the catalytic Ti sites in the porous structure of (R)-1?
What is the effect of substituting the methyl group in PhSMe with isopropyl on the oxidation reaction?
data.answer: The oxidation reaction still gives a conversion of 84%, but for a bulkier group like benzyl, the conversion decreases.
